availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Andrew Lucas Robinson (Vanderburgh County, Indiana, politician, attorney, and customs surveyor)

body.p: Vanderburgh County, Indiana, politician, attorney, and customs surveyor. Vermont native. Married to Caroline Robinson. Father of Mary Robinson and Sarah Robinson. Member of the House of Representatives of the State of Indiana from Vanderburgh County from December 6, 1851, to January 13, 1845. Attorney in Vanderburgh County in 1850. Attorney in Vanderburgh County in 1860. Employed Amelia Stafford as a domestic servant in Vanderburgh County in 1860. Customs surveyor in Vanderburgh County in 1861.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Indiana, Vanderburgh County, Pigeon, District 4, p. 382B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Indiana, Vanderburgh County, Pigeon, p. 785.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Indiana, Vanderburgh County, Evansville, District 1, p. 159B.
William E. Henry, State Librarian, Legislative and State Manual of Indiana for 1899 and 1900 Compiled from Official Records, (Indianapolis: William B. Buford, State Printing and Bining, 1899), p. 54, 94.
Lineage Book of the Charter Members of the National Society of the Daughters of the American Revolution, eds. Mary S. Lockwood and Susan Riviere Hetzel (Washington, D. C.: National Society of the Daughters of the American Revolution, 1897) vol. 21: year, p. 216.
